name: cleavable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be cleaved (= separated or divided) or to cleave (= separate or divide) : The drug is believed to stabilize the cleavable complex, preventing the rejoining of DNA strands. Although diamonds are the hardest of minerals, they are also among the most cleavable.
More examplesFewer examplesThe stabilization of the cleavable complex is responsible for DNA fragmentation.All of these minerals are easily cleavable.There are many possible types of cleavable bonds.The market for these treatments is segmented by technology into cleavable linkers and non-cleavable linkers.
